item.title: Elasticsearch Combined Cluster
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Combined Cluster An Elasticsearch combined cluster is a group of one or more Elasticsearch nodes where each node can perform as master, data, and ingest nodes simultaneously. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using kind.

item.title: Elasticsearch Topology Cluster
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Topology Cluster An Elasticsearch topology cluster is a group of Elasticsearch nodes ( >= 3 ) where each node is assigned with a dedicated role such as master, data, and ingest. In a topology cluster, there has to be at least one master node, one data node, and one ingest node. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.
